name: run_command
description: Executes the provided terminal command within the current workspace context, requiring the exact command string. Commands such as `cd`, `pwd`, and environment commands (`export`, `unset`, `env`) are handled internally, while others execute externally and may modify workspace files. For interactive or pager commands (e.g., `git diff`, `less`), you must append ` | cat` to the command string to prevent hanging; for long-running processes, set `is_background` to True.

command.description: The exact terminal command string to execute. For interactive or pager commands, you must append ` | cat` to the string.

is_background.description: A boolean flag that, when `True`, runs the command as a background process (e.g., for servers or watchers). Defaults to `False`, executing the command in the foreground and waiting for its completion.
